definition: station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Vernon charges in, stands looking blinded, like an enraged bull.
sentences.chinese: 弗農衝進來站住，兩眼發直，像一頭激怒了的公牛。

sentences.english: Don't look back, and don't stop anywhere in the plain!
sentences.chinese: 不可回頭看，也不可在平原站住。

sentences.english: We stood, waited for the beat, and tried again.
sentences.chinese: 我們站住，等待合適的節拍，接着跳。

sentences.english: Russia has dug itself in, basically, into Abkhazia and South Ossetia.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯基本上已經在阿布哈茲和南奧賽梯站住了腳。

sentences.english: Jesus stopped and called them. "What do you want me to do for you?" he asked.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌就站住，叫他們來，說，要我爲你們作什麼。

sentences.english: The sentry cried "Halt" as he saw us.
sentences.chinese: 哨兵看到我們時，大呼“站住”。

sentences.english: Five feet apart they paused as if by mutual consent .
sentences.chinese: 相隔五步路，大家就不約而同的站住腳跟。

sentences.english: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)
sentences.chinese: 我豈因他們不說話，站住不再回答，仍舊等候呢。

sentences.english: He saw the two young people and stopped in front of them.
sentences.chinese: 他看見了兩個年輕人，在他們面前站住了。

sentences.english: He stopped at the corner and looked about him vacantly .
sentences.chinese: 他在街角站住了，向四面茫然地望了望。

sentences.english: He hared off the moment I shout "stop! ".
sentences.chinese: 我一喊“站住”，他就飛快地跑了。

sentences.english: She stopped for a minute and thought and gazed at my face in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 她站住沉思了一會，在黑暗中注視着我的臉。

sentences.english: The soldier challenged the stranger as soon as she appeared.
sentences.chinese: 陌生人一出現，士兵便喝令她站住，加以盤問。

sentences.english: But I doubt that it can be sustained.
sentences.chinese: 但是我懷疑這種看法能否站住腳。

sentences.english: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him
sentences.chinese: 耶穌站住，吩咐把他領過來。

definition: to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
to come to a stand/to stop
to get out of the way
to get out of the way/to step aside
to turn one's head/to turn around
to run fast/to sprint/to gallop/Gee up!/Run for it!
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
